content:
I'm glad you're looking to try something new! I've got some delicious slow cooker recipes that feature peppers and onions as main ingredients. Here are a few ideas to get you started:

**1. Slow Cooker Pepper and Onion Chicken Fajitas**

Place boneless chicken breasts, sliced peppers, onions, fajita seasoning, and diced tomatoes in the slow cooker. Cook on low for 6-8 hours, then shred the chicken and serve with warm flour or corn tortillas, sour cream, and salsa.

**2. Pepper and Onion Chicken Tacos**

Add diced peppers and onions to the slow cooker with boneless chicken breasts, taco seasoning, diced tomatoes, and chicken broth. Cook on low for 6-8 hours, then shred the chicken and serve with tortillas, shredded cheese, and your favorite toppings.

**3. Slow Cooker Pepper and Onion Beef Barbacoa**

Place beef brisket or beef shanks, sliced peppers, onions, garlic, and beef broth in the slow cooker. Cook on low for 8-10 hours, then shred the beef and serve with warm tortillas, diced onions, and salsa.

**4. Slow Cooker Pepper and Onion Chicken Quesadillas**

Add diced peppers and onions to the slow cooker with boneless chicken breasts, chicken broth, and fajita seasoning. Cook on low for 6-8 hours, then shred the chicken and serve with tortillas, shredded cheese, and your favorite toppings.

**5. Pepper and Onion Pulled Pork**

Place a pork shoulder, sliced peppers, onions, and barbecue sauce in the slow cooker. Cook on low for 8-10 hours, then shred the pork and serve on a bun with coleslaw and pickles.

**6. Slow Cooker Pepper and Onion Vegetable Stew**

Add sliced peppers and onions to the slow cooker with your favorite vegetables (such as zucchini, carrots, and potatoes), vegetable broth, and diced tomatoes. Cook on low for 6-8 hours, then season with your favorite herbs and spices.

**7. Slow Cooker Pepper and Onion Chicken Tortilla Soup**

Place boneless chicken breasts, sliced peppers, onions, diced tomatoes, and tortillas in the slow cooker. Cook on low for 6-8 hours, then shred the chicken and serve with crusty bread, shredded cheese, and your favorite toppings.

These are just a few ideas to get you started. You can always adjust the recipes to fit your taste preferences and dietary needs. Happy slow cooking!
